Docs.param: A pointer to snap-in interface that will be queried for the interface. If < is set to , this should also be a pointer to the snap-in's or interface that will be queried for . Be aware that this value can be .

A value that specifies whether to create a console-provided notification handle that is used to route the notification to the appropriate or interface.
If is set to , the parameter should be a pointer to the or that receives the notification.
Reserved for future use. This value should be .
Set to if the item is in the scope pane. Set to if it is in the result pane.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CreatePropertySheet (string title, int type, int cookie, Microsoft.CLRAdmin.IDataObject pIDataObjectm, uint dwOptions);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CreatePropertySheet(string title, int32 type, int32 cookie, class Microsoft.CLRAdmin.IDataObject pIDataObjectm, unsigned int32 dwOptions) cil managed
Public Sub CreatePropertySheet (title As String, type As Integer, cookie As Integer, pIDataObjectm As IDataObject, dwOptions As UInteger)
public: void CreatePropertySheet(System::String ^ title, int type, int cookie, Microsoft::CLRAdmin::IDataObject ^ pIDataObjectm, System::UInt32 dwOptions);
abstract member CreatePropertySheet : string * int * int * Microsoft.CLRAdmin.IDataObject * uint32 -> unit

Docs.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the title of the property page. This parameter cannot be .
creates a property sheet and creates a wizard.
Cookie value of the currently selected item. This can be when this method is called by an extension snap-in.
A pointer to the interface on the data object for the cookie. If the value of this parameter is , MMC will not call any of the methods implemented by extension snap-ins.

A value that specifies the flags that can be set by the method call. The parameter can be a combination of the following values: | Value | Description | | --- | --- | | MMC\_PSO\_NOAPPLYNOW | Remove Apply Now button. | | MMC\_PSO\_HASHELP | Add a Help button. | | MMC\_PSO\_NO\_PROPTITLE | Ignored for wizards. For property sheets, if this option is specified, then the words "Properties for" will not be inserted at the beginning of the property sheet title bar. | | MMC\_PSO\_NEWWIZARDTYPE | Use Wizard 97 style. |

MemberSignature.Value: public void Show (IntPtr window, int page);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Show(native int window, int32 page) cil managed
Public Sub Show (window As IntPtr, page As Integer)
public: void Show(IntPtr window, int page);
abstract member Show : nativeint * int -> unit

Docs.param: A value that specifies the handle to the parent window.
A value that specifies which page on the property sheet is shown. It is zero-indexed.
Docs.summary: If the type that has been set in is a property sheet, this method displays a property sheet frame that is parented to a hidden window. If the type that has been set in is a wizard, this method displays a property sheet frame parented to the handle that is passed to this method.
